text: Phages are viruses that infect bacteria.
Phage therapy is an alternative to antibiotics.
Phages were discovered over 100 years ago.
Phages are the most abundant entities on Earth.
There are 10^31 phages on Earth.
Phages can be specific to one bacterial species.
Phage cocktails target multiple bacteria.
The FDA has allowed compassionate use of phages.
Phages inject their DNA into bacteria.
Lysogenic phages integrate into bacterial DNA.
Lytic phages kill bacteria immediately.
Phages can transfer genes between bacteria.
CRISPR evolved from bacterial phage defense.
Bacteria have immune systems against phages.
Restriction enzymes cut foreign DNA.
Bacteria and phages are in an evolutionary arms race.
Phages can evolve resistance quickly.
Phage display is used to develop drugs.
Antibodies can be developed using phage display.
The 2018 Nobel Prize honored phage display.
Viruses are not considered alive by most scientists.
Viruses lack cellular structures.
Viruses cannot reproduce without a host.
The largest viruses are bigger than small bacteria.
Giant viruses were discovered in 2003.
Mimivirus is larger than some bacteria.
Pandoravirus has over 2,500 genes.
Some giant viruses have their own immune systems.
Virophages are viruses that infect other viruses.
Viruses may have been the first life forms.
Some scientists think viruses preceded cells.
Retroviruses insert their genes into host DNA.
8% of human DNA came from ancient viruses.
Endogenous retroviruses are viral fossils in our genes.
Some viral genes help with placenta development.
Syncytin genes came from ancient retroviruses.
Viral genes may have driven mammalian evolution.
HIV is a retrovirus.
Antiretroviral therapy suppresses HIV.
HIV can be suppressed to undetectable levels.
Undetectable HIV is untransmittable.
PrEP prevents HIV infection.
HIV originated from chimpanzees.
HIV crossed to humans in the early 1900s.
The AIDS epidemic began in the 1980s.
Over 40 million people have died from AIDS.
AIDS research led to major scientific advances.
Protease inhibitors revolutionized HIV treatment.
HIV mutates rapidly, evading immune responses.
A vaccine for HIV remains elusive.
Influenza viruses constantly mutate.
Flu vaccines are updated annually.
The 1918 flu killed more than World War I.
Spanish flu infected 500 million people.
The 1918 flu came from birds.
Flu pandemics occur every few decades.
Swine flu emerged in 2009.
Bird flu has pandemic potential.
H5N1 has a high mortality rate in humans.
Flu viruses have 8 RNA segments.
Antigenic shift creates new flu strains.
Reassortment occurs when two flu strains mix.
Pigs can harbor both bird and human flu.
Coronaviruses are named for their crown-like shape.
SARS emerged in 2002.
MERS emerged in 2012.
COVID-19 caused a global pandemic in 2020.
SARS-CoV-2 likely originated in bats.
Coronaviruses mutate to form new variants.
The spike protein allows coronavirus entry.
ACE2 is the receptor for SARS-CoV-2.
Long COVID affects many survivors.
COVID vaccines were developed in record time.
Operation Warp Speed funded vaccine development.
Pfizer and Moderna vaccines use mRNA technology.
Viral vectors deliver genetic material in some vaccines.
Adenovirus vectors are used in some COVID vaccines.
Johnson & Johnson used viral vector technology.
Protein subunit vaccines use viral pieces.
Novavax is a protein subunit vaccine.
Inactivated vaccines use killed viruses.
Sinovac and Sinopharm use inactivated virus.
Vaccine platforms can be adapted for new diseases.
mRNA technology could lead to HIV and cancer vaccines.
Smallpox was eradicated through vaccination.
The last natural smallpox case was in 1977.
Smallpox killed 300 million people in the 20th century.
Edward Jenner developed the first vaccine.
Cowpox provided immunity to smallpox.
The word vaccine comes from vacca (cow).
Polio is nearly eradicated worldwide.
Only Afghanistan and Pakistan have endemic polio.
The Salk vaccine used inactivated poliovirus.
The Sabin vaccine used weakened live virus.
Oral polio vaccine helped eradicate polio.
Measles vaccination prevents 2-3 million deaths yearly.
Measles can cause immune amnesia.
Herd immunity protects vulnerable populations.
Vaccine hesitancy threatens herd immunity.
Anti-vaccine movements have existed since vaccines began.
